queries.description: Using certain types for template arguments can cause undefined behavour if the template uses the argument in an unchecked way that conflicts with the arguments' available characteristics.
queries.name: A template should check if a specific template argument is suitable for this template

A14-1-1.title: A template should check if a specific template argument is suitable for this template.

queries.description: Using a template constructor that participates in overload resolution against copy or move constructors makes the code more difficult to understand.
queries.name: A template constructor shall not participate in overload resolution for a single argument of the enclosing class type

A14-5-1.title: A template constructor shall not participate in overload resolution for a single argument of the enclosing class type.

queries.description: Using template argument types that do not provide all members used can lead to compilation errors and can be difficult to diagnose.
queries.name: A type used as a template argument shall provide all members that are used by the template

A14-7-1.title: A type used as a template argument shall provide all members that are used by the template.

queries.description: Template specialization shall be declared in the same file (1) as the primary template (2) as a user-defined type, for which the specialization is declared, otherwise the behaviour is undefined.
queries.name: Template specialization shall be declared in the same file as the primary template or as a user-defined type

A14-7-2.title: Template specialization shall be declared in the same file (1) as the primary template (2) as a user-defined type, for which the specialization is declared.

queries.description: Using function template specialization in combination with function overloading makes call target resolution more difficult to understand.
queries.name: Explicit specializations of function templates shall not be used

A14-8-2.title: Explicit specializations of function templates shall not be used.

A8-2-1.title: When declaring function templates, the trailing return type syntax shall be used if the return type depends on the type of parameters.

queries.description: A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter otherwise assignment involving types with pointer members may not behave as a developer expects.
queries.name: A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is generic

M14-5-3.title: A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter.

queries.description: Not using a qualified-id or `this->` syntax for identifiers used in a class template makes the code more difficult to understand.
queries.name: In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->

queries.description: Not using a qualified-id or `this->` syntax for identifiers used in a class template makes the code more difficult to understand.
queries.name: (Audit) In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->

M14-6-1.title: In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->.
